description: A unique archipelago formed by the world's largest mangrove trees, the Yarukiman Mangroves, whose roots have grown above the water. The island is covered in a special resin that creates soap bubbles, giving it a fantastical appearance. Located near Marine Headquarters and the Red Line, it serves as the final stop before the New World.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Sabaody Archipelago
keyEvents.description: The Thousand Sunny reaches the Sabaody Archipelago, and the crew observes the island's distinctive soap bubbles and mangrove tree structure.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of one of the most critical arcs in One Piece, where the Straw Hats will face their greatest challenge yet.

keyEvents.title: Devil Dias Attempts to Escape
keyEvents.description: A runaway slave named Devil Dias desperately runs through the streets of Sabaody begging for help to remove his explosive collar.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the dark reality of slavery on Sabaody despite its proximity to Marine Headquarters.

keyEvents.title: Introduction to Sabaody's Dark Side
keyEvents.description: The episode reveals that Sabaody Archipelago, despite being close to Marine Headquarters, is a hub for slave traders, bounty hunters, and pirates.
keyEvents.significance: Exposes the hypocrisy of the World Government and the systemic corruption in the One Piece world.
